definition: to have a full house/to be sold out/no vacancy
customer/visitor/guest
Manchu ethnic group
to fill/full/filled/packed/fully/completely/quite/to reach the limit/to satisfy/satisfied/contented

sentences.english: I'm afraid the hOtel's full on those dates.
sentences.chinese: 那幾天逸旅館恐怕都客滿了。

sentences.english: This club is packed every night.
sentences.chinese: 這間俱樂部每晚都客滿。

sentences.english: There are no vacancies in single room but we have a double room.
sentences.chinese: 單人房都客滿了，不過我們還有一間雙人房。

sentences.english: The Capital Theatre is booked out.
We are fully booked for single rooms.
He pulled wires and got us a room at the crowded hotel.
sentences.chinese: 他走門路，給我們在客滿的旅館裏弄到了一間空房。

sentences.english: The bar is full now. Do you care to wait for about 20 minutes?
sentences.chinese: 酒吧現在客滿，請稍等約20分鐘好嗎？

sentences.english: A person who answered the phone at Nanhai Hotel in Nansan told China Daily that the hotel was fully booked.
sentences.chinese: 中國日報的記者打電話到南傘南海酒店，被告知客滿。

sentences.english: I' m sorry, but we're fully booked for single rooms.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我們的單人房都客滿了。

sentences.english: The airline bumped us from the flight.
sentences.chinese: 因航班客滿我們沒能乘上班機。

sentences.english: The new musical wowed them on Broadway.
sentences.chinese: 這出新歌劇演出以來一直客滿。

sentences.english: By the time John pulled into the little town, every hotel room was taken.
sentences.chinese: 約翰開車來到這座小鎮時，旅館已客滿。

sentences.english: All the rooms of this hotel are occupied.
sentences.chinese: 這家賓館的所有房間都客滿了。

definition: filled to capacity (of theater, stadium, gymnasium etc)
to reserve a seat/to book a table/reservation
to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper
to line up
take-out (fast food)/(outer part of) tire/as well/besides/into the bargain/outer zone
to eat in (at a restaurant) (Tw)/to take the medicine orally
restaurant
continuously; in an endless stream (idiom)
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
noisy
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
fully booked/every seat taken
to eat one's fill/to be full
brightly lit
to do business/to trade
shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
